Package stars

Class FlatFileDatabase<T extends FlatFileObject>

java.lang.Object
stars.FlatFileDatabase<T>
Type Parameters:
T - A class that implements FlatFileObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
CourseDatabase, IndexDatabase, StudentDatabase, UserDatabase
public abstract class FlatFileDatabase<T extends FlatFileObject>
extends java.lang.Object
A class that reads, stores and write data from from to a flat file. This class only stores and performs operations with objects that implements the FlatFileObject Interface. Users can initialize a database with a flat file, retrieve and modify its contents, and write the modified state back to a flat file. Since different data types have different ways of being read, written and indexed, each of those types should have their own database class that extends this class and overrides its methods to the specification of those types.
Since:
20/11/2020
Version:
1.0
Author:
Lai Ming Hui

    • add

      public void add​(java.lang.String key, T obj)
      Associates the specified object with the specified key in this database.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to be added into database
      key - The key for the object to be indexed

    • remove

      public void remove​(java.lang.String key)
      Removes an object indexed by the key from the database
      Parameters:
      key - Key of object to be removed.

    • get

      public T get​(java.lang.String key)
      Retrieves the object indexed by key.
      Parameters:
      key - Key of object to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The object indexed by the key, or null if it is not in the database.

    • getContents

      public java.util.Collection<T> getContents()
      Returns the a Collection view of values stored in this database. Changes to this collection view will be reflected in the database.
      Returns:
      The collection view of the values in this database.

    • getKeys

      public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getKeys()
      Return the set view of the keys stored in this database.
      Returns:
      Returns the set view of keys stored in this database

    • printContents

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> printContents()
      Returns a list of strings, each string being a flat file representation of a value stored in the database.
      Returns:
      A list of string representations of values stored in the database.

    • openFile

      public void openFile​(java.lang.String fileName) throws java.io.IOException
      Opens a file that contains data in flat file format, converts the text data into actual objects of this database's target type and stores them into this databse. The file should be a text file containing data in flat file format
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file to be opened.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs opening the file

    • parseLine

      public abstract T parseLine​(java.lang.String line)
      Parses a flat file string and initializes a flat file object with the data.
      Parameters:
      line - A flat file string
      Returns:
      The initialized object.

    • writeFile

      public void writeFile​(java.lang.String fileName) throws java.io.IOException
      Write the contents of the database to the specified file in flat file format.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The file to be written to
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the named file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, does not exist but cannot be created, or cannot be opened for any other reason
